skill.name: Global Validation
skill.description: Implement server-side validation with allowlists, specific error messages, type checking, and sanitization to prevent security vulnerabilities and ensure data integrity. Use this skill when creating or editing form request classes, when validating API inputs, when implementing validation rules in controllers or services, when writing client-side validation for user experience, when sanitizing user input to prevent injection attacks, when validating business rules, when implementing error message display, or when ensuring consistent validation across all application entry points.

skill.author: DevanB

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that provides best practices for implementing secure validation. It contains no executable code, network calls, or file system access. The skill promotes security best practices including input sanitization, allowlist validation, and protection against injection attacks.

content.value_statement: Protect your application from injection attacks and data integrity issues. This skill guides you to implement comprehensive validation with sanitization, type checking, and clear error messages.
actual_capabilities: Guides creation of form request classes with proper validation rules
Provides sanitization techniques to prevent injection attacks
Creates specific, actionable error messages for users
Ensures consistent validation across web forms and APIs
Validates business rules and data integrity
limitations: Requires Laravel framework for full implementation
Does not provide automatic client-side validation
Validation rules must be manually maintained
Cannot prevent all types of security vulnerabilities alone

use_cases.title: Secure API validation
use_cases.description: Implement robust validation for REST API endpoints to prevent malicious input and ensure data integrity.

use_cases.title: Form security hardening
use_cases.description: Add comprehensive validation to web forms with proper error handling and user feedback.

use_cases.title: Input sanitization implementation
use_cases.description: Deploy allowlist-based validation to prevent SQL injection, XSS, and command injection attacks.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Form Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Laravel Form Request class for user registration with validation for name, email, password, and confirm password fields. Include proper sanitization and specific error messages.

prompt_templates.title: API Input Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement validation rules for a POST /api/products endpoint that accepts name, price, description, and category. Use allowlist validation and sanitize all inputs.

prompt_templates.title: Business Rule Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create validation for an order form that checks product availability, validates customer credit limit, and ensures delivery date is within business rules.

prompt_templates.title: Custom Validation Rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement a custom Laravel validation rule that validates international phone numbers and can be reused across multiple forms and APIs.

output_examples.input: Create validation for a contact form with name, email, and message fields
output: - Required field validation for all fields
- Email format validation with proper sanitization
- String length limits (name: 3-100 chars, message: 10-1000 chars)
- Custom error messages in user's language
- Validation passed to controller via dependency injection

best_practices: Always validate on the server-side even if client-side validation exists
Use allowlists (define what's allowed) rather than denylists for security
Provide specific, actionable error messages that help users correct their input
anti_patterns: Never trust client-side validation alone - always validate server-side
Avoid generic error messages like 'Invalid input' - be specific about what went wrong
Don't use denylists or blacklists for validation - they're easy to bypass

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Laravel 11 and 12?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill provides validation guidance compatible with Laravel 11 and 12, including the latest Form Request features.

faq.question: Does this skill generate client-side validation code?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on server-side validation but can guide you on implementing complementary client-side validation for better user experience.

faq.question: Can I use this with other PHP frameworks?
faq.answer: While designed for Laravel, the validation principles (allowlists, sanitization, error messages) apply to any PHP framework.

faq.question: How does this skill protect against injection attacks?
faq.answer: It guides you to use Laravel's built-in sanitization, parameterized queries, and allowlist validation to prevent SQL injection, XSS, and command injection.

faq.question: What if my validation rules are complex with multiple conditions?
faq.answer: The skill covers conditional validation, custom rules, and business logic validation to handle complex scenarios while maintaining security.

faq.question: How is this different from Laravel's default validation documentation?
faq.answer: This skill provides security-focused guidance with real-world examples, emphasizing protection against common vulnerabilities while maintaining user experience.
